meanings.definition: A small North American freshwater fish of the pike family.
meanings.sent1: The pond was teeming with pickerels, darting around in the clear water.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen enjoy catching pickerels in the nearby lake for sport.
meanings.sent3: The pickerels in the stream were having a lively discussion about the best hiding spots.
meanings.sent4: In the pond of ideas, the pickerels of creativity swam freely, inspiring all around.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering scales of the pickerels caught the sunlight, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: A person who picks or gathers things.
meanings.sent1: The market was bustling with pickerels, selecting the ripest fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: As a professional pickerels, she had a keen eye for valuable antiques.
meanings.sent3: The group of pickerels scoured the beach for seashells, each trying to find the most unique one.
meanings.sent4: She was a pickerels of words, carefully choosing each one to craft her stories.
meanings.sent5: The pickerels of the forest gathered herbs and berries with precision and care.
